title: [Large-Scale] VR Learning Design Based on Special Relativity Theory Exploration

context.prior_knowledge: High school-level foundational physics knowledge (concepts of time, space, velocity)
context.additional_context: Flexible lesson design centered on practical training for working professional learners, incorporating VR simulation activities using personal BYOD devices.

learning_goals: Learners can explain core concepts of special relativity theory (time dilation, length contraction, relativity of simultaneity).
Learners can experimentally verify the invariance of the speed of light principle through VR simulations.
Learners can apply relativistic phenomena to social contexts (e.g., GPS calibration) through inquiry-based activities.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
